intro: Verbesina harlingii, commonly known as the yellow beggarticks, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its most distinctive feature is the bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Verbesina harlingii is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showcasing its adaptability to different environments.
